(0, 2781).name: University of Victoria Earth System Climate Model (UVic ESCM)

(0, 2781).name: land and ocean carbon uptake
(0, 2781).label: variable
(0, 2781).description: The process by which the land and ocean absorb and store carbon from the atmosphere>

(0, 2781).name: climate-carbon cycle feedback
(0, 2781).label: variable
(0, 2781).description: The interaction between climate change and the carbon cycle, where changes in climate affect the ability of the land and ocean to absorb carbon>

(0, 2781).name: coupled climate-carbon cycle models
(0, 2781).label: model
(0, 2781).description: Computational models that simulate the interactions between the climate system and the carbon cycle>

(0, 2781).name: photosynthesis
(0, 2781).label: process

(0, 2781).name: vegetation and soil carbon uptake

(0, 2781).name: ocean circulation
(0, 2781).label: ocean circulation

(0, 2781).label: location

(0, 2781).name: anthropogenic CO 2

(2371, 5222).name: Coupled climate-carbon cycle models
(2371, 5222).label: model
(2371, 5222).description: Sophisticated computer simulations that integrate physical, chemical, biological, and dynamical processes to represent and predict Earth's climate system and carbon cycle>

(2371, 5222).name: biogeochemical seawater properties
(2371, 5222).label: variable
(2371, 5222).description: The chemical and biological characteristics of seawater, including factors such as pH, nutrient levels, and marine life, which influence the ocean's ability to absorb CO2>

(2371, 5222).name: nutrients
(2371, 5222).label: variable
(2371, 5222).description: Substances required by living organisms to grow and thrive, including nutrients such as nitrogen and phosphorus that impact marine biota and terrestrial ecosystems>

(2371, 5222).name: vegetation productivity
(2371, 5222).label: variable
(2371, 5222).description: The rate at which plants produce organic matter through photosynthesis, influenced by factors such as CO2 levels, temperature, and nutrient availability>

(2371, 5222).name: climate feedback
(2371, 5222).label: variable
(2371, 5222).description: A process where a change in the climate system triggers a response that either amplifies or dampens the initial change, such as the climate-carbon cycle feedback>

(2371, 5222).name: climate-carbon cycle feedback
(2371, 5222).label: variable
(2371, 5222).description: A process where climate change affects the carbon cycle, and the carbon cycle in turn influences the climate, creating a feedback loop>

(2371, 5222).name: land biosphere
(2371, 5222).label: location
(2371, 5222).description: The region of the Earth's surface where plants and animals live, including forests, grasslands, and other terrestrial ecosystems>

(2371, 5222).name: terrestrial ecosystems
(2371, 5222).label: location
(2371, 5222).description: Ecosystems that exist on land, including forests, grasslands, and other areas where plants and animals interact>

(2371, 5222).name: vegetation dynamics
(2371, 5222).label: variable
(2371, 5222).description: The study of how vegetation changes over time in response to factors such as climate, CO2 levels, and land use>

(2371, 5222).name: ocean circulation
(2371, 5222).label: ocean circulation
(2371, 5222).description: The large-scale movement of water masses in Earth's oceans, driven by wind, density differences, and the Coriolis effect, which regulates Earth's climate>

(2371, 5222).name: atmospheric CO2 concentration
(2371, 5222).label: variable
(2371, 5222).description: The amount of carbon dioxide present in the Earth's atmosphere, which influences the climate and is impacted by human activities and natural processes>

(2371, 5222).name: ocean acidification
(2371, 5222).label: variable
(2371, 5222).description: The decrease in pH levels of the ocean over time, caused by the absorption of excess CO2 from the atmosphere, which affects marine biota and ecosystems>
